formattedAddress: 535 E 70th St, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: 535 E 70th St, New York, NY 10021-4823, USA

originalText.text: In the last several years, I've been to HSS for three joint replacement surgeries: both shoulders and my right hip. Everyone I've had the pleasure of coming in contact with has been outstanding. I've had numerous X-rays and MRIs, and the Radiology Department has been very friendly, efficient, and definitively professional. I can't say enough about how wonderful my HSS experiences have been.

originalText.text: Great hospital, but they regularly run behind. Like, 2+ hours behind. If you dare to go, bring a snack and a book. The waiting room doesn't get cell service.

text.text: Great hospital, but they regularly run behind. Like, 2+ hours behind. If you dare to go, bring a snack and a book. The waiting room doesn't get cell service.

originalText.text: Unfortunately I always have an issue when booking an MRI and it is very frustrating. Typically pre authorizations are not completed and I’ve had a couple of wasted visits. So this time I booked 3 weeks I advance for my usual Paramus location they have booked me in the wrong place. Another day booked off work!

text.text: Unfortunately I always have an issue when booking an MRI and it is very frustrating. Typically pre authorizations are not completed and I’ve had a couple of wasted visits. So this time I booked 3 weeks I advance for my usual Paramus location they have booked me in the wrong place. Another day booked off work!

originalText.text: One should never need a hospital but, if needed, this is the #1 for orthopedics.  Great staff (what is their secret for hiring such a qualified staff?).  Superbly organized, like clockwork. Caring nurses (special shout out to nurse De Leon and nurse Lam). Support is there from entry to exit. In short it's a one-of-a-kind hospital anywhere.  Thank you!  C Z Ovits

originalText.text:
The entrance to this part of the hospital is at the midpoint of an underpass that connects 71st St and 70th St, so you can enter from either street for your convenience.

Scheduling is pretty bad and disorganized. They made me wait for an hour before they got me in their system due to clerical error. The person who took down my name and birthday refused to acknowledge another staff who was sitting next to her already took down my name and birthday an hour earlier. Another guy has been standing around for two hours. Another woman asking who they are supposed to talk to for surgery.
